quizDescription: Test your wit with these challenging riddles that will make you think outside the box.

questions.question: I speak without a mouth and hear without ears. I have no body, but I come alive with the wind. What am I?
questions.explanation: An echo is a sound that is heard when sound waves bounce off a surface and return to the listener. It 'speaks' but has no mouth and 'hears' without ears.

questions.question: I have keys but open no locks. I have space, but no room. You can enter, but you can't go inside. What am I?
questions.explanation: A computer keyboard has keys (letters/characters) but doesn't open locks. It has space between keys but no physical room you can enter.

questions.question: I'm always hungry, I must always be fed. The finger I touch will soon turn red. What am I?
questions.explanation: Fire is always hungry for fuel (such as wood or paper), and when it touches something, it can cause it to burn and turn red.

questions.question: I'm not alive, but I can grow. I don't have lungs, but I need air. What am I?
questions.explanation: A balloon can grow in size when filled with air, but it's not a living thing and doesn't have lungs.

questions.question: I can be cracked, made, told, and played. What am I?
questions.explanation: A joke can be 'cracked' (told), 'made' (created), 'told' (shared), and 'played' (used for humor).

questions.question: I'm a word of letters three, add two and fewer there will be. What am I?
questions.explanation: The word 'few' has three letters. When you add 'two' (the word 'two' itself), you get 'fewer,' which means there are fewer letters.

questions.question: I'm not alive, but I can die. What am I?
questions.explanation: A battery provides power, but it can 'die' when it runs out of energy. It is not a living thing.

questions.question: I'm full of keys but can't open any locks. What am I?
questions.explanation: A piano has keys (musical keys) but can't open locks. It's a musical instrument.

questions.question: I'm tall when I'm young and short when I'm old. What am I?
questions.explanation: A candle is tall when it's newly lit (young) and becomes shorter as it burns (old).

questions.question: I'm black and white and loved all over the world. What am I?
questions.explanation: A soccer ball is typically black and white, and the sport of soccer is loved and played all over the world.
